characters: TIGHT ON THE CIRCLE OF JENSEN'S OK FINGER SIGN
BLACK SCREEN. OVER IT IN SMALL LETTERS
NOW THERE'S SOMETHING WE CAN DO
TIGHT ON THE THREE BLACKBERRY MESSAGES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open air, the guys sit in the back. In the middle of the desert with nothing to do but wait. Roque holds the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cards. The four take them. Lick the back, slap them to their foreheads -- two deuces (Jensen and Roque), a three (Pooch), and an eight (Cougar). Pitiful cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a feeling about this one, Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mama had that feeling too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At which point, JENSEN PULLS A KNIFE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and tosses it into the center of the circle. HIS BET. Roque responds by tossing a .357 MAGNUM from his belt in. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the one with the hollow points?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, I'm definitely in then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts in a Desert Eagle. Jensen pulls a second, meaner looking knife. Twirling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This even me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly how many knives do you have, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen grins and STABS IT down into the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar - your bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Silent Man stares at the others. Two deuces and a three. He shakes his head at them. Before he can bet...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, losers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN to Clay. Mid-30's. Their leader, and you gotta be a bad- ass to lead this crew. Tired eyes. A weariness to him already. And hands faster than you can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIPPING ACROSS THE DESERT. Pooch drives, Clay shotgun, others in the back. Passing a COMPUTER TABLET to Jensen: 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authenticate and backtrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send us out to the middle of nowhere to "wait for instructions"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good, this baby came out of the Kandahar Spook Station, controller's codename is Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the tablet back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an Agency gig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't get to pick what needs to be done. (reading from tablet) Quaeda-wannabe name of Fadhil is running a terrorist assembly line out around the Khyber Pass--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm shocked. Shocked, I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find it, we paint it for a laser targeted bomb. No muss, no fuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For that we had to put on a blindfold and turn around three times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd rather take on fifty mujas with AK's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He upshifts a gear as the Humvee drives on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrorist looking fellow talks with another. We are... 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys, now in full on Black Ops Special Forces combat desert fatigues, perched high above what looks like a RUN DOWN AFGHAN PRISON. Roque with the field glasses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got eyes on Fadhil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch fires up the LASER DESIGNATOR and aims it at the compound. A high pitched whine as he does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Michelangelo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar sights down the LASER SCOPE of his LONG RIFLE. Just taking in the scenery. Jensen, into a field radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropkick, this is Pinball, confirmed eyes on, target is designated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DESERT HAWK ROARS THROUGH THE SKY, enroute to target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, target acquired, exfil chopper is enroute. ETA to fireworks is eight minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, we'll break out the earplugs. (to the others) So who wants to get a game? We got eight minutes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, for the first time COUGAR SPEAKS. With concern:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay immediately looks THROUGH HIS SCOPE -- 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF CHILD-SLAVES on the ground BY THE PRISON, being led off a truck. The others look too. Reacting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropkick, children are at target site, repeat, we have eyes on children at target site - advise.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold the line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATIC. Seconds tick by...

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Acknowledged, maintain position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintain position? Colonel-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropkick, we strongly recommend cancellation of payload delivery-

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Abort order can only come from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay GRABS THE RADIO from Jensen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission Controller is Agency, Codename Max, repeat, Codename Max, so get him on the horn and-

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Already have, Pinball, your orders stand. Prep for exfil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATIC. A beat. The others stare at Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar takes the butt of his rifle and SMASHES THE LASER DESIGNATOR TO BITS! Clay, into the radio: 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropkick, this is Pinball, targeting equipment has suffered system failure, am calling an abort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATIC. Then, a DIFFERENT VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, that was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice is even. Distinctly unmilitary. Almost stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? This is a secure

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Very stupid, Colonel... Franklin... Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay blinks - no one uses names on comms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max? There are children on site-

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And you think I didn't know that? Not the sharpest of knives in the drawer, are you? We locked coordinates the moment you painted; delivery will occur on schedule. Max out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATIC. Clay hits the send button to respond - gets a SQUELCH. Cursing, tossing the radio to Jensen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Jensen, call the General at the Firebase, get him to abort-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't, they're jamming us-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then contact the plane directly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying all channels) Negative, we're screwed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do... 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face, stricken. They all are. And then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay hefts his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others stare at him. Automatically begin checking their own weapons. Roque runs it down for them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five against a fortress, and we've got maybe six minutes before an airstrike sets the world on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! BAD GUYS firing wildly as our guys' HUMVEE PLOWS through the GATE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're going with the fifty mujas with AK's option after all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS -- We see just how good these guys are. Cougar on his knee in the back -- snipes SINGLE SHOT KILL takes out SEVEN MEN. Roque pulls to a halt in the center of the compound -- Bad Guys, coming out of the woodwork with AUTOMATIC WEAPONS. As the guys hop out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and Jensen, get a truck for the kids, the rest of us will be out in five-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -airstrike's in four and change-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -out in four. On me! 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay leads ZONE COVERAGE toward the building -- Roque and Cougar run middle -- QUICK DEATH STRIKES. Images BLAST fast and savage as these men KILL THEIR WAY INTO THE FORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque calmly kicks in the door -- kills FIVE MEN sitting around a table with TWO YOUNG GIRLS in the middle -- the terrified girls run to him. The BAD GUYS have no chance - Fast. Precise. SPECTACULAR. Our crew takes the fort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING THROUGH a tight hallway, they find the children locked in a large empty room. They start leading them out. One LITTLE BOY stops Clay. In PASHTUN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay checks the time. 3 MINUTES TO AIRSTRIKE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roque and Cougar) Get 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque and Cougar hustle the kids toward the exit while Clay moves DOWNSTAIRS into the darker sublevels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay kicks in a door to find A MAN - Looming over a SHACKLED BOY. Unbuckling his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man pales. Realizing the American understands what he was about to do, backing away, BEGGING IN PASHTUN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar DOESN'T MOVE. Instead, he eerily raises his hand and wordlessly POINTS TO A CELL. In the corner. And Clay hears a MOAN emit from it. VAGUELY HUMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar lowers his arm. Goes upstairs, dragging his bear. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay turns. Approaches the cell. Looks down into it... it's clear from Clay's face that it's SOMETHING HORRIFIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shooooot meeee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Max sent you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...was IA Field Ops hunting rogue agents... Max caught me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He torture rasps and spits small chunks of death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is rogue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something Horrific leans forward out of the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're off-mission aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay just stares.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING HORRIFIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's the mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fadhil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't care about Fadhil... He's cleaning up the mess. You're his mop. I'm the mission....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay's just staring into the burning, crazed eyes of Something Horrific.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING HORRIFIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kill me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you out- 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already dead... Kill ME-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! A BULLET pierces what used to be left of Something Horrific's CHEST. Not fired by Clay...

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING HORRIFIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thaaaank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he dies. Clay turns - COUGAR. Lowers his rifle. Speaks one word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds up his watch. 40 SECONDS LEFT. Speaks another:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Cougar BURST from the fort, FIRING and RUNNING FULL TILT towards the commandeered TRUCK LOADED WITH KIDS As they leap into the back, Pooch hits the gas:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you stop for coffee in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he RUNS OVER two Bad Guys trying to stop them at the gate. The sound of a JET APPROACHING. Roque to Jensen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of blast radius we looking at? Jensen, calculating on the computer tablet. Shows an animation mock-up to Roque - huge blast radius. To Pooch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fort and the retreating Truck below us mere specks as the DESERT HAWK SWOOPS IN and RELEASES ITS PAYLOAD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence as it falls... and then STRIKES below an orange FIREBALL BALLOONING OUTWARDS... 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripping across the dunes, FIREBALL EXPANDING behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're in the clear-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the fireball ENGULFS THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FIRESTORM: All Pooch can see is FLAMES through the WINDSHIELD as they plow through the destruction. Glances in the REAR-VIEW:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Coug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar's sleeve, FULLY ABLAZE. He casually rips it off and tosses it out the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD - The fire clears... to reveal a 30 FOOT DROP. The guys scream as they PLUNGE OVER IT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOMP! The Truck buries itself nose first in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Smoke rises from a crater that was once the Fort. The doors of the truck creak open. Most of the YOUNGSTERS GIGGLE. Fun ride. As the guys help them out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was great, wasn't it? My favorite part was when we were completely on fire. What was yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of a BLACKHAWK CHOPPER APPROACHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exfil incoming. How are we gonna explain the kids, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay doesn't seem to hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel? (Clay looks up) The kids. What do we tell 'em? 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Clay seems to shake off his daze as the BLACKHAWK sets down. Walking up to the chopper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, you're to evac these civvies to the Firebase immediately-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, our orders are to transport a five-man team only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay's eyes dart down to the Pilot's neck. A SILVER CRUCIFIX hangs around it. Clay, softer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to leave twenty three kids in the desert to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough room for them and you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot nods. Our guys begin loading the kids on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay helps Omar on last. The kid looks at him. He knows perfectly well what Clay saved him from in that basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay nods. A beat. The Pilot pulls the stick back and the CHOPPER ASCENDS. The kids wave goodbye to our guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar, holding Clay's gaze as they rise. Only broken as the chopper begins to recede into the distance. The last Clay sees of him is that ratty little TEDDY BEAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute little buggers. Hope they can make it to our court-martial. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Pooch, we're not going to be court-martialed - if anything, we're going to die of thirst wandering the desert, right Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, see if you can cut into that Blackhawk's chatter--I want to know if he rats us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jensen tunes his radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how we getting back? Hitchhike? Magic carpet? I say magic carpet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they hustled up some air support after all - that's a Pakistani MiG up there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen's tuning into the MIG's frequency. Looking nervous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys... This is bad...

dialogues.speaker: MIG PILOT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Max, Cobra One. Bandit locked, twelve o'clock low... Their eyes go wide with understanding....

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Understood, Cobra One. Kill Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Cougar have ALREADY BEGUN RUNNING towards the receding chopper on the horizon. As the MIG SWINGS IN BEHIND THE BLACKHAWK....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOOSH... The MIG FIRES - AIR TO AIR MISSILE... WHOOMP! The Blackhawk's tail rotor SHEARED OFF, the chopper spinning and falling but still intact... 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, the pilot, from somewhere SCREAMING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auto-rotate, go with it, you can still put her down if you-

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And again.

dialogues.speaker: MIG PILOT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ...Fox Two. The SECOND MISSILE from the MiG SLAMS INTO THE BLACKHAWK proper. Burning, spinning... FALLING. Clay and Cougar, screaming by the time they reach the wreck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMAR'S TEDDY BEAR, BLACKENING to a crisp. Clay tries to dive into the flames, but COUGAR DRAGS HIM BACK. No use, anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's alive inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A safe house. A LARGE MAN stands in the shadows, watching as Roque, Jensen, Pooch, Cougar, and Clay yell back and forth at FENNEL - a CIA Handler:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about "MAX?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He set up the Operation-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no operation! You were never radioed orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to him! 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kill a friendly Afghan warlord, probably lose us the support of half the tribes in the region, and your alibi is "MAX?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - are you saying you're Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, Max is an Agency code for a rogue agent or operation-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking-

dialogues.speaker: LARGE MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There is no specific Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LARGE MAN finally steps out of the shadows. Special Forces, like our guys. WADE. They know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Max" is catch-all for exactly what you've been accused of. Terminology's been around since the 50's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as the guys take this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't kill those kids, Wade. Wade studies him. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fennel sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. We'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch Wade and Fennel leave. Now alone. SILENCE. After a bit, Pooch looks down. Under a little table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade left his suitcase. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hits them all at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They BOLT for the door. LOCKED. Run to the window. THREE FLOORS UP and it has BARS ON IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to the case) Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good with bombs, man-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care--Roque, Pooch, get those bars off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque and Pooch - SWISS ARMY KNIVES OUT. PHILLIPS HEAD attachments, slotting them into the SCREWS that hold the barred WINDOW FRAME in place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen POPS OPEN the briefcase. Wires and dials aplenty..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First set of screws out, moving onto the second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a remote detonator--enough for them to get clear, maybe ten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm not good with bombs! How are those bars coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second set out, moving onto the third and final....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry... 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third set out, ripping the frame from the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON THE CITY BLOCK: As the SAFE HOUSE EXPLODES! Debris flying far enough to shower the open air bazaar being held two blocks East. HOLD on the smoldering ruins. AS WE SLOWLY FADE TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rain slicked tarmac. MARINES carrying FIVE FLAG DRAPED COFFINS off a troop transport carrier. Our guys' FAMILIES watching. Clay's mother. Jensen's girlfriend. Pooch's wife and daughters. Tears in their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere secret. Our guys' PERSONNEL FOLDERS. Each being opened. Each being stamped "DECEASED". BACK TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Marines SALUTE the passing coffins. POOCH'S WIFE lowers her head, weeping. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice quiet neighborhood. White picket fences, the whole nine. WE'RE WATCHING from outside the kitchen window of a Cape Cod two story. POOCH'S WIFE JOLENE doing dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Older. Hair cropped. Springfield, Massachusetts - NOW. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dries her hands and heads upstairs. We catch a glimps of her in the upstairs hall. Then in her DAUGHTER's bedroom. 4 YEARS OLD NOW. Mom, putting her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backyard, by the swingset, a figure watches. POOCH Indulging in a nightly ritual...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico City. CARNIVALE. Day of the Dead. Jesters and masks. Music. A man with a cowboy hat walks among them. COUGAR. Sees Mexican Police eyeing him. Walks a little faster. Hat pulled low as fireworks explode above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix, Arizona. A late night internet cafe, wedged between a donut shop and spinning studio. JENSEN sits. Alone. Playing INTERACTIVE ON-LINE COMBAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood, Florida. DOGS IN FULL SPRINT. A few thousand SPECTATORS. Not the Derby, but reasonably enthused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CHEAP SEATS -- CLAY and ROQUE. Three years older. But in no way bolder. They look almost... Broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque's got his feet up. Sucks lazily on a straw embedded in what looks like a SODA POP. Clay's got BINOCULARS, following the action on the track -- Muscle shredded greyhounds tearing over the dirt. One crosses the FINISH LINE. Roque checks their ticket. Yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay's got the binoculars up, slow-checking the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You placed the bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me the money. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was stupid of me, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay drums his fingers along the binocs as he scans. We see on his right hand, between his thumb and index finger A TATTOO. A TEDDY BEAR. Looks just like Omar's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes, what, three in a row?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something glint-flashes...catches Clay's eye. He looks across the track, towards the PARKING LOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where you're messing up? You're putting all our money on the dogs with the best odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've just gone crazy with that approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY SCANS THE LOT -- A YOUNG WOMAN in tight jeans walks towards a black pick up, carrying a PAIR OF BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never play a longshot, you're never gonna win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay doesn't respond. Watching her. Roque exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at a dogtrack at 10 a.m. - could this get any more sleazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if we were drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque takes a pull on his straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Roque wolf Big Macs in a 1988 Chevy Crew Cab. FAMILIES eat outside. KIDS play like hamsters in tubes. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stay two more days, try to get some of the cash back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami. Jai-Alai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various PEOPLE walk to and from their cars. Clay and Roque shield their faces from them instinctually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take much more of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the run. It occasionally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. Grinding out lunch money on five dollar sports bets, wincing everytime some overly Aqua- netted cow stares at my face for more than two seconds-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the point where I'm thinking we ought to try to reach out to the Company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we did was say the word "Max" and they blew up a building. CIA even gets a whiff of where we're at, they'll call in an airstrike. (shakes his head) Until we figure out how we can take Max down and get clear, we lay low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Metro Dade POLICE CRUISER rolls into the McDonald's. Clay watches close as it pulls into a parking spot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Due respect, you're nobody's Colonel anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime you want to move along you go right ahead- 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the others? Least I still talk to them. You pushed them away. "Max this, Max that" - we never even saw the guy, Clay-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard his voice. Guy with a voice is a guy with a throat. And if he's got a throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hiding out in the parking lot of a goddamn McDonald's--You actually think we're in any position to take on some shadowy CIA super- spook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a stellar plan - we can use this as our base of ops! (gestures to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch can run the motor pool out of the ball pit and Jensen can set up communications by the slide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, seeing one of the COPS say something to the other..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Roque FIRES UP THE ENGINE as the COPS get out of the cruiser. Pulling smoothly into the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque pulls up to their shitbeater Motel. Tension still between them. He gets out, turning back to his friend:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there too. I remember. But he won. We lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time for a new game. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Roque heads to the Motel. Clay looks down at his quarter eaten burger. He needs some real food...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BUSTER'S BOOZE & BURGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay at the bar, eating a steak and drinking alone. Honky tonk on the juke, mix of sawdust and blood on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG WOMAN enters - she's hot, feels familiar. Clay eyes her as she orders a drink, dodges several GUYS.

dialogues.speaker: PARTICULARLY OFFENSIVE GUY
dialogues.text: Yabba Dabba Doo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches Clay's eye. Rolls her eyes. Clay's paying more attention to his T-Bone than the girl. She slides up next to him. Her name's AISHA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay turns back to his food. Not used to attractive women instigating conversation. Aisha watches as Clay eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the steak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still watching him. It's getting annoying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a bite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't eat red meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slows me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha studies Clay. If we've been paying close attention, we might ID her as the race track binocular chick. We're not sure if Clay does. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got nice arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to her) I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, slugger... I like arms. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I not look relaxed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think we can change that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Aisha enter his motel room. Aisha checks out the sparse accommodations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, it's everything a girl could dream of. Got a bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I specifically requested the only hotel room in the world that doesn't have a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lookin' to turn a "yes" into a "no" here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay points to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha checks herself in the mirror. A touch of lip gloss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what brings you to Florida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay IN THE BEDROOM. Leans over - stretching his hamstrings. Does a few subtle twists - Loosening up. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Convention.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Convention for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Clay looks around. Weakly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Air conditioners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE BATHROOM - Aisha studies herself in the mirror. Stretching her arms, prepping for some physical activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have whole conventions devoted to air conditioners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha comes back out. Both now stretched and loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet I would. Where were we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They study each other. Aisha slowly moves towards Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were about to tell me how much you enjoy spending time at the dog track... Aisha smiles, tracing her fingers down his stomach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw me there did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay strokes her cheek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't see me at the McDonald's though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lips, inches from touching... 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a proposition for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Clay DECKS HER. She REELS BACK -- LOADED GLOCK up and out and -- Clay ducks left -- BACKHANDS HER with his forearm -- sends her FLYING across the room -- PAUSE. Both breathing hard. Staring at one another:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hear me out. I don't want to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He foot-plants, spins, re-attacks and IT IS ON! INSANELY VISCOUS: tearing the room to utter shreds. Fists SMASHING. A FACE KICK, plaster SMASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HURLS a twenty six inch color TELEVISION at him. This EXPLODES against a wall. Sparks give to flame as the room starts to burn hot around these two warriors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to fight like RABID WOLVES. And they're GRINNING. Enjoying this. THEN FREEZE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AISHA ON TOP OF CLAY -- Each has a BUCK KNIFE up and tigh against the other's throat. Blades on skin. TIE GAME. Neither giving. FLAMES AROUND THEM:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room's on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noticed. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life. Back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay spits blood and sucks air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to clarify that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max. I can help you. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This clearly has effect on Clay - Substantial Effect. Clay stares up at Aisha. FLAMES ALL AROUND THEM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Aisha walk away from the BURNING MOTEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too tough if you know where to look. You guys aren't exactly subtle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIRE ENGINE screams past them towards the burning hotel as if to illustrate her point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know I was alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counted the number of teeth found in the safehouse debris in Karachi. Not nearly enough for five men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're alive? Just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's to stop me from putting a bullet in your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want Max and I can tell you how to get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is up to something big, isn't he? Agency wouldn't have sent you otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives a little smile. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try, but I'm working alone here. If I wasn't, I wouldn't need your help. Ready for the important part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This plane contains a truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This truck contains a cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cargo is very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a riddle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cargo belongs to Max. You steal the cargo, Max comes looking for it, you grab Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a brilliant plan, and oh, so simple too. What's the cargo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. So you want me to steal some super secret cargo known only to you and the bad guy, and I'm supposed to do this because you know the name Max and look good in a pair of jeans? Sorry, sister. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. Begins walking away. She calls out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! (he turns back) You really think I look good in these jeans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cargo's heroin. Max uses it to fund his off the books ops. And it comes straight from the poppy fields of the late Jamal al-Fadhil. (knowing full well) Oh... does that name mean something to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Clay stares at her, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used you to kill Fadhil and take over his operation, that's right. What did you think you were doing there in the first place? Fighting for truth and justice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know I can trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check my background. I'm an ex- Company hitter. First job was a junior field officer in Shanghai. You can Google it under Shanghai Hilton Decapitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mostly Google porn. Then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Chinese and an Italian arms dealer in Bangkok. With my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show-off. Then? 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I stopped auditioning for you. This is a check for ten grand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not mercenaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operational capital, that's all. (holding out the check) You've been waiting three years for a shot at this guy. You're not gonna get another. You want Max, this is it. He takes it. She hands him some papers along with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intel on the shipment. You check it out, you check me out, you decide - are you in or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUGAR chilling by a small fire. Working his way through a bottle of tequila. His blackberry rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH in a Motel 6 Laying in bed alone, watching an old Jimmy Stewart movie. Blackberry rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN's in bed with TWO GIRLS from his spin class. Blackberry rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city midday is UTTERLY PACKED. Overflowing. The capital of the next great Superpower. Delhi, India. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOP FLOOR OFFICE SUITE of a high end technology company Degrees on the walls. A Bollywood musical BLARES from a TV loud enough to cover up the SOUNDS OF BEGGING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE INDIAN SCIENTISTS -- A short guy, a tall guy, and a really fat guy -- On the floor, BOUND, terrified, looking up at a tough looking bastard standing over them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE. Our burly man from the safe-house. Now he works for the suit in the brown French club chair. The Big Man, Master of Disaster, Trouble on a Firestick... MAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we cannot do this... We cannot do what you ask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me - is this a moral issue or a financial issue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moral issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You object morally to this deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm sorry. Please leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes a moment. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what I'm hearing. I'm hearing "No." I'm hearing "Leave," and I'm hearing "I'm sorry." Is that what I'm hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... you must leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods to himself. He thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Okay, so that is what I'm hearing. Now, I want you to listen. Listen carefully because I want you to hear this. Wade? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade hauls him up the FAT SCIENTIST. Without hesitation, he walks him over to the large glass window looking down FIFTY THREE STORIES above Delhi and HURLS HIM OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXPLODING through the glass. As the poor bastard FALLS AND SCREAMS... The other scientists scream at the sight. Max turns to Wade, bewildered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me the nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "hit him in the face" nod, not a "throw him out the window" nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that's what you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At most--at most that was a "break his fingers" nod. (slams his fist) I mean Jesus, Wade, the man was scientific genius. Granted his weight signaled that he had certain impulse control issues, but that's no reason to throw his fat ass out a fifty story window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if to a child) I think I speak for everyone here when I say that your actions were excessive and, yes, more than just a little wasteful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks over at the cowering scientists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then again, it seemed to have had the desired effect - toss Short Round out next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade starts for the Short Scientist. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade stops.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT SCIENTIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have a different moral perspective than our late colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need one to test and one to use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One to test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course one to test - you think I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will need much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will have much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Wade are up and out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Wade, striding towards the elevators. Passing cubicles that Indian workers cower under - we realize Max's heavily armed Henchmen had SEIZED THE ENTIRE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call our people at Goliath, tell them we'll have a special package arriving on the 17th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps his fingers and the Henchman follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Orleans. A non-descript warehouse among many.

dialogues.speaker: ROQUE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So this is what your girl came up with, huh? 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large and empty. Clay and Roque take a look around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than a ball pit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're thinking clear on this? (off Clay's look) I know you. When you slip, it's always cause of a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name one time that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla wasn't the problem, Carla's husband was the problem-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla's husband wasn't the one who

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Yes. She shot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But only in the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Emma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma doesn't count, we never slept together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she put a bomb in your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit, that took some of the romance out of the relationship. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now this chick, first time you meet her, burns down our hotel. Also, she kills people for a living. These are not good signs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clear, Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque studies Clay long and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be. Or we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERRUPTED as a DOOR CREAKS OPEN - Clay and Roque immediately have their PISTOLS OUT facing down an enterin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. We missed you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUGAR is with him. Clay and Roque lowers their weapons and go to embrace them... Pooch BEAR-HUGS Roque. Cougar nods to Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's this I hear about Clay gettin' us killed over a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the SHADOWS:

dialogues.speaker: AISHA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Been a long time since anyone called me a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys START as she emerges. All woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Lady! Ten outta ten for stealth and shit, but next time could you just knock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She put a bomb in your car? 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was volatile. Aisha, meet Pooch, Roque, and Cougar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as she takes this motley bunch in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You can't hang out with anyone just named "Phil"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another CREAK - Jensen enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail, hail, the gang's all here! Colonel. Roque. Pooch. Silent Bob. Hottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need a moment alone with the boys if you don't mind, but I'd like to reserve the right to awkwardly hit on you later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd expect no less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys admire her form as she leaves. When she's gone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have on her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides a pants-busting crush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her intel checks out. The cargo will be arriving here in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I completely trust her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grew up in Afghanistan, Mom was a local, Dad was white devil... oh, and CIA's got a kill order out on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As does Hamas, Sien Fein, MOSAAD-- pretty much everyone with the exception of PETA wants this chick amscrayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last CIA email flagged with her name says she was digging for information about a special project... (looks up at them) "Codename: MAX". A moment as this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to wet her cause she's lookin' into Max. That sounds familiar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could those files-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing his question) -have been planted for us to find? (shaking his head) CIA timestamp, digital watermark... Someone would've had to go to a lot of trouble, and I mean a lot, to fool me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay nods. Looks to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we go with her. Pooch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Pooch nodding:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen? 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. Cougs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar nods his assent. Only one left. ROQUE. They all turn to him. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen smacks his fist on the table, excited:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot damn! Back with the Colonel, doing another bid for God and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Country turned her back on us, and God can screw. This one's for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyone who calls me "Colonel" better be ready to take a beating or an order. We ain't soldiers anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan, my civilian brothers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep. We start tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going bird hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A White Bell AB-139 CHOPPER glides into frame -- FLYING over a small series of white sanded jungle islands...

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It used to be so simple. A post 9/11 world... 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOWLER MONKEYS taunt-scream up as the chopper slow-circle over the beautiful deserted island. Outer Fijian Islands.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As a country we spoke with one voice, moved with one purpose. We had a wicked boner for doing the right thing, and now look at us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wearing a Hawaiian shirt and Raybans. ZINC on his nose, rubbing suntan lotion on his forearms. To Wade:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 percent of the globe is tooling up to whack us and we're too busy losing our nerve to notice. It's Us versus Them and right now my money would be on them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DROPPING FAST out of the chopper -- SOARING DOWN low -- TRACKING WITH a howler monkey up a PALM TREE -- Then airborne as the monkey leaps twenty feet to another.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wasn't it Thomas Jefferson who once said the tree of freedom must be watered with etcetera, etcetera? We need to wake people up, Wade. We need to hit them in the face, angry up the blood, give them their balls back. We TRACK WITH our lead monkey up to something very un- monkey like... Something SINISTER. A metallic, trunk- like object. Flashing lights and transponder devices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to give them a ten megaton reality check. (ala John Lee Hooker) Boom Boom Boom Boom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-millisecond breath. Then, UTTER DESTRUCTION!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MULTI STAGED NUCLEAR SHRED BLAST -- Trees, earth, water are sucked in then -- HURLED OUTWARDS in a series of SHOC WAVES and fire balls. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSUNAMIS ERUPT, as the chopper shudders from the blast. When the MUSHROOM CLOUD clears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned silence in the chopper. Then Max whoops like a 10 year old who's just seen the world's best fireworks show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's safe to say it works!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade, not quite as enthused. Max notices. His face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, talk about hard to impress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Wade, stepping off the chopper as it powers down. Max walks towards his office. Wade, calling after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Company's with you on this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda... Sorta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the drill, they don't like to know how the sausages get made. What do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. Just want to make sure everyone gets paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's coming from our Afghanistan operation. And what the Company doesn't know won't hurt them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless they're within the blast radius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max puts his hand on Wade's shoulder. Earnestly: 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna saving our country, Wade. The United States of America will benefit greatly from what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born in Quebec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, fine - we're saving North America, does that make you happy? Just get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stalks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A US ARMY HUMVEE tears PAST CAMERA, just missing a couple of freaked out jack rabbits blast-hopping for their lives On perimeter patrol at 80MPH down an endless desert road.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO TRANSMISSION, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Base One, this is Cavalier 415. Sector eight perimeter clear, proceeding to sector nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen. Radio mic. His fingers rapid tap worn keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio; drawls) Roger that Cav 415, we have a report of a civilian vehicle breakdown on U.S. 70, sector nine, grid four. Please assist as required.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four patrol SOLDIERS. The driver throws a hard right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army of one, my ass. Goddamn Triple A service...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Kenworth Heavy pulled off to the side. Pooch works on the front right tire. Sweating buckets in the desert bake. The Humvee approaches. TWO SOLDIERS get out. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a hand, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch looks up from his tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty feet off the road. A brown blanket slowly rising... REVEAL the long black barrel of a SNIPER RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOPE POV -- Colors and graphics we've never seen before. Cougar's got his own thing going on. More Jerry Garcia than Tom Clancy. Soldier One's THROAT is smack dab in the middle of it. CLOSE ON COUGAR'S TRIGGER FINGER: Slight squeeze. Silenced weapon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier One slaps at the burning sting in his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAOW! Something just bit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a two inch TRANQ-DART off his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the dart) Is this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three other soldiers see the dart and LEAP out when..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM BEHIND THE TRUCK -- ROQUE rises ARMS OUT. Wedged in each hand -- TWIN JET BLACK .45 CALIBER COLT STUN PISTOLS BLASTING AWAY... The soldiers stagger, twist and stumble before succumbing to the Demerol. LIGHTS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of HEAVY IRON RELEASING as the WALLS START TO SEPARATE, revealing we are INSIDE THE BROKEN-DOWN TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make the call. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen taps into the military emergency band. Takes a breath, centers himself, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base One, this is Cavalier 415! We have been in a collision with a civilian vehicle! Carvey's dead an' Freeman's hurt bad! He's messed up his neck! He can't move! Oh god, it's horrible! We need medevac immediate! HE'S GOT KIDS, BASE

dialogues.speaker: BASE ONE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Roger, Cavalier 415! We're scrambling a chopper, hang in there! Jensen, all smiles, looks up at Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert De Niro who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and Roque have the four drugged soldiers laid out on the sand. All four are clearly breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping like babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about their ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay steps off the trailer with a heavy duty air hoist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip it. TIGHT SHOTS of the air ram attached to the undercarriage of the Humvee. The tires start to lift off the ground... higher... Four pairs of hands start rocking the truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and Jensen, on one side. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think's up with that "don't call me Colonel" stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classic loss of identity. Clay defined himself by his place in the military structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was his way of measuring the good he did in the world. Without it, he's just another loser like the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch blinks, impressed. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's a website where you can download MP3's of donkeys farting? How cool is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FINAL PUSH... and the Humvee FLIPS. FROM JENSEN'S RADIO

dialogues.speaker: BASE ONE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Cavalier 415 this is Medevac Delta. Be advised, we are airborne and in- bound to your position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, everyone get into character...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen and Roque LIE ON THE GROUND by the flipped Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of work to bum a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Jensen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up, Roque. You're dead, I'm the spinal injury - Spinal injury can talk, dead can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking or I'll break your neck for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, you have to get more into your role! Dead guy! No talking! Dead guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay leans against the truck. In the distance, the faint outline of a massive DOUBLE ROTOR TROOP TRANSPORT CHOPPER 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the pilot as he moves in on the accident scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base One, this is Medevac Delta. We have visual on Cavalier 415.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay waves the chopper in. It lands on the road. TWO EMTs leap out and race towards the fallen soldiers. The first EMT kneels by Jensen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright buddy, we're gonna get you patched up in no time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-you ever treat anyone who'd been gut shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, in Iraq. What a mess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen pulls his COLT, presses it up into the EMT's GUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means you know what's coming to you if try to play hero. Now, lose the radio mic, Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two pilots wait behind full reflective face shields

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they jawing about out there? We're burning fuel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLACK-CLACK. The pilots turn as TWO MACHINE GUNS jam up on them from out of the darkness. Pooch and Cougar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard of car-jacked? You've just been chopper-jacked, my man. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're robbing the US Army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRANQ-TRANQ! The Pilots slump. Pooch, to Cougar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he says it out loud, it does sound kinda ridiculous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay pops his head in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wild goose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch reaches in and rips the chopper's TRANSPONDER OFF..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHOPPER, now UNDER A TARP on the back of the truck trailer. The TRANSPONDER, strapped to a SMALL ROCKET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all set here. Ready to take a giant step for... well, for guys who steal stuff, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen FIRES THE ROCKET. The transponder takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful. Let 'em chase that.

dialogues.speaker: BASE ONE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Medevac Delta, this is Base One. What's your situation, over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch gets up behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team gets into the big double cab. Pooch fires up the engine and the heave rig tears out onto the highway..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AFTER THEY'RE GONE -- On one of the drugged soldiers. Trying to sit up. He looks around. WIDE: Seven soldiers out cold on the side of the road... Alone. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys are prepping. Pooch and Clay check out maps. Cougar, in full face mask, spray paints something big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, what you want is a gas turbine generator running a force- fed rectifier unit, hook it up to the fuel tank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha sits, watching in silence. Jensen approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you grew up in the Hindu Kush, huh? That must've been rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the chopper) Uh-huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any hobbies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha, never taking her eyes off the chopper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a girl, I collected human ears. I had over three dozen pairs when a feral dog came into our camp one night and took them. The dog was good eating, though. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go somewhere else now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He departs. Aisha stands, walking over to the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are small arms gonna be a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Pooch look at the new girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken care of - we lined the hull with half inch steel plate. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which brings us to our next question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PULLS a DESERT EAGLE and LEVELS IT at Aisha's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your angle in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha just smiles. Clay, more annoyed than worried:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving you a chance to get even. That's all you need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque stares at Aisha. Neither backing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna shoot her, Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thumbs back the hammer... A TENSE MOMENT... And then Roque lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming with us. And if anything feels like a set-up, I put a bullet in her skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound fair? 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, completely. Now, if you'll excuse me, it's time for prayers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Muslim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you are a sharp one--and don't let any of these other boys tell you different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, she turns and walks away into the shadows. Roque lowers the weapon. A beat. To Clay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked up on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with Roque, man. Agency thinks we're dead. We show up alive and kickin', start waving our dicks around in public, they're gonna make it their business to bury us. They'll call us terrorists, all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think we are now? (to all of them) Best case scenario, this gets us face to face with Max-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't? What if we never get face to face with him. Are you gonna be able to live with that? Ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay doesn't reply. A pall, cast over the guys. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, let's just say it out loud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do this, we're declaring war on the Central Intelligence Agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence, as the guys take this in. Then, from the corner: 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They started it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWOOPING DOWN over the waterways, threading our way betwe buildings, past the islands slamming into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A G-550, tire chalked. A fork lift removes a large VAULT- LIKE PACKAGE from the back of the plane -- THE CARGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fifteen ton ATTACK-STABILIZED CASH TRANSPORT RIG idles, surrounded by TWENTY ASSAULT TROOPERS, loading up. Machin guns, frag grenades, body armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BY THE JET -- WADE and FENNEL, our briefcase bomb friends talks with a G. Gordon Liddy wrinkle muscleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of this moment, the truck is designated an extraterritorial zone of immunity. Under no circumstances whatsoever are you or your men to allow the package to leave the truck before it's secure in the compound - to do so would be considered an act of treason and punishable as such.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood and acknowledged, sir. As the package is loaded into the MONSTER ARMORED RIG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten men ride with the package and another ten ride chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten rock hard WARRIORS in a beefed up chase van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two truck armored convoy pulls out of the private airport and passes a parked TOWN CAR... 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, Roque, and Jensen watch the armored trucks pass by. Roque has a silenced long gun out as the second truck passes. As Roque PULLS THE TRIGGER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silenced AIR BLAST -- we TRAVEL FAST with Roque's ordinance -- SMACKING SILENT onto the rear bumper of the lead truck. A ballistic, putty-coated recon tracker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen's laptop GPS goes hot. Green dot indicates CONVOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we wired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Belushi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target is westbound. Heading for the bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay fires up the Town Car and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL -- LOOKING DOWN as the armored cars head towards the city. TILT UP to reveal the CRESCENT CITY CONNECTION eight suspended lanes spanning the Mighty Mississippi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE -- Looking down at the bridge traffic. Sliding into frame, buckle-harnessed and very armed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO HUNDRED FEET ABOVE GROUND. Lashed into a BRIDGE SUPPORT. He racks the bolt of his NTW-20 ANTI MATERIAL RIFLE - a monster of a weapon with a bulky starlight scop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the FIRST SWAT TRUCK reaches the center of the BRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Take em'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar FIRES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everything begins happening very fast. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT TRUCK'S nearside front wheel EXPLODES, blown clear off the axle mount --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheel spins away, bounces wild, smashes a windshield

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver, wrestling with the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I'm losing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Truck SLEWS sideways -- PLOWS into a car! The Driver SLAMS the truck in reverse, FLOORS IT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar FIRES AGAIN -- the other front wheel DETONATES, and the truck's nose SLAMS down on the asphalt GRINDING SPARKS! Going nowhere fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screeches to a hard stop behind. SECURITY CREW OUT -- WEAPONS RAISED -- taking up DEFENSIVE POSITIONS. Ice cold professionals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Form a defensive perimeter around the truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out of their minds, there's no way off this bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now at the entrance to the bridge. Roque smiles as he hefts an MGL-40 GRENADE LAUNCHER. FIRING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THICK TEAR GAS EXPLODES in dark blues, billowing across traffic. SECURITY MEN CHOKE, lost in the SMOKE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masks on! Secure the package!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they? I can't see them- 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUGAR pumps a round into the EMPTY CHASE VAN -- Armor- glass BLASTING APART, showering the roadway -- Fennel DIVES for cover, PANICKING -- Lifts the radio to his lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code RED! We are under attack! Need Chopper Support right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROQUE fires another TEAR GAS GRENADE into the melee -- CIVILIANS running and screaming -- TOTAL PANDEMONIUM --

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Acknowledged, EVAC is enroute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the CHASE VAN is BLOWN APART behind them! Fennel tryin to orient through smoke and gas. Then, a NEW SOUND... DEEP RUMBLING. Thick bass vibrations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thick tear gas being blown aside by the thunderous twin-rotor downwash of a CHINOOK HEAVY LIFT CHOPPER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bellies in low, the boarding ramp already lowering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade crouch-runs to the SWAT TRUCK, HAMMERING the rear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavalry's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors BURST OPEN and the SWAT Team CRASH-ROLLS the precious CARGO CRATE towards the Chinook's boarding ramp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! Point cover! Go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT Guys laying down point cover as their comrades hustl the crate into the Chinook's WINDOWLESS HOLD. The ramp RISING as Fennel dives onboard as well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade makes a "take off" sign to the Chinook pilot who flips him a salute as THE CHINOOK LIFTS INTO THE AIR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ramp closing. The team and cargo safely aboard... 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing Cougar's sniper-harness, which now HANGS EMPTY. Twisting in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear the rotors fade into the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade slumps against the burnt out wreckage of the chase van. Sighing in relief. SILENCE. His radio crackles:

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER PILOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Chopper Support--we are inbound your position, ETA five minutes! Hang in there! As a HORRIFIED LOOK OF REALIZATION crosses Wade's face and he stares up into the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT Guys pull off their masks and high-five. They think they kicked ass. Fennel, reaching for the cockpit door handle... He can't turn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? It's welded shut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows too! We're sealed in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the FAINT YELLING of Fennel and the Swat Guys in the hold. The Chinook Pilot flips up his goggles to revea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's POOCH! AISHA sitting co-pilot. Both grinning as they hear the protestations from behind them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The middle of nowhere. A small clearing. Skeeters and crickets harmonize. Clay waits with Jensen and Roque. THE CHINOOK crests the tree line. Hovers above... 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fennel and the SWAT Guys try to maintain balance and personal dignity as they stumble and fall all over each other... The chopper SETS DOWN. The men gather themselves. Weapons up. Checking clips, safeties off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down, okay! You go the second the ramp lowers! Hit them hard, three round bursts, center mass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha clambers onto the Chinook's hull, clutching a RUBBE HOSE. Screws the end to an inlet valve marked "FIRE RETARDANT SYSTEM". Looks down at Clay. With a grin:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the valve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a 3-inch turn valve. Hard hands grab and open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys are about to get the surprise of their lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut off as a CLEAR LIQUID begins to rain down on them from the SPRINKLER SYSTEM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell they trying to do, drown us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, that smell! It's- gasoline!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their EYES GO WIDE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HYDRAULICS WHINE. The RAMP LOWERS. The gas drenched soldiers BURST OUT, weapons up. Squinting through the fumes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY STANDS ALONE. The men fan out around him. Multiple rifles TRAINED AT HIS HEAD from every direction. Fennel blinks, surprised to see him alive. Nevertheless: 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat the ground, or they blow your head off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First and only warning, Clay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay calmly LIGHTS A CIGARETTE. TIGHT ON THE BURNING CHERRY: The soldiers, wide eyed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasoline. Muzzle flash. Think about it. AS THAT SINKS IN -- Fennel looks like his puppy just died

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASOLINE DRIPS from the muzzle of his own tooled up H&amp G36 assault rifle... Clay takes a long smooth drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and then the fight just goes out of the SWAT Team. They DROP THEIR GUNS and RAISE THEIR HANDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boys. Now, let's see what kind of cargo you got in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, no bullshit - you open that box and we all die. Clay steps up to him. Near nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already dead, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP! Clay's fist to Fennel's jaw. Knocking him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
