dialogues.text: TIGHT ON FENNEL as he and the Team sit bound and gagged in the back of the Chinook. As the ramp rises, he shoots panicked glances to Clay. The ramp closes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay turns back to 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CRATE on the ground in front of our guys. Pooch and Cougar hydro-pop the locks. OPEN TO REVEAL an interior crate. Smaller, polished steel. A TEN DIGIT numeric KEYPAD on top, and a LOGO STAMPED on the side - GOLIATH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goliath the oil company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay looks to Aisha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be how he moves the drugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. The super evil bad guy is in bed with the world's largest oil company. That's just fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch hefts a tire iron. Smacking it into his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to go ask Fennel the combination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I can bypass no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jacks his laptop into the keypad. A few keystrokes and HISSSSSSS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voila! Ten million dollars of horse, comin' up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second crate opens... Revealing a THERMO-NUCLEAR WARHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys stand there. COMPLETELY STUNNED. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TIMER display BLINKS ON and begins COUNTING BACK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jensen, you're up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen blinks. Still in shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not good with bombs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nukes. That's a nuke. Who makes nukes? Department of Defense. DOD Mainframe. I gotta hack the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would really be good if you didn't talk right now- get that casing off for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, staring at the warhead warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if that sets it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we die thirty seconds early - do it. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha and Pooch with drills POP THE SCREWS. Lifting the casing off the bomb housing - looking down at the MULITITUDE OF COLORED WIRES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got wires - red, blue, green, white, yellow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just hold position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's also pink-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's typing like the damn wind now -- IMAGES on his lapto FLYING PAST as he HACKS THE D.O.D...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to make this more dramatic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost... Almost... Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer crashed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His screen, FROZEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, cause this is the time for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm not good at bombs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have time to reboot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. They're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, someone pick a color!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull out all the wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever hear of a clock radio that exploded cause you unplugged it--pull out all the wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no other options POOCH DOES. The clock, STILL GOING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the wires FIZZLE. Then NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening it without the code must have triggered the timer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Roque PULLS HIS GUN. Levelling it at Aisha:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saved our lives-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know? 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay TURNS SUDDENLY, stalking towards the Chinook...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fennel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Losers stand around Fennel, who's been CRYING. Urine stain on his pants. Sniveling, spilling his guts rapidly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max thinks the country's lost it's way, gone soft in the War on Terror! This is his solution!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay JAMS A GUN to his temple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaborate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted us to nuke a U.S. target, pin it on the ragheads and boom - freedom is on the march again! The same people who want us to pull back will be screaming to turn the place into a parking lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Clay FIRES - INCHES FROM Fennel's HEAD! Fennel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mall of America! Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare down at him in disbelief... 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious! It's his sense of humor! He told us we could choose between there and Epcot Center...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as our guys take this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, it's like we were framed by Dr. No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Goliath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what would an oil company want with the Middle East?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ships that service their offshore oil rigs are exempt from US Customs! It's how Max gets the drugs in and out of the country-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is conspiracy theory bullshit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not! There's proof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's heroin operation - Goliath keeps accounts of the shipments!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, dude, they'd be morons to keep records of shit like this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on a stand-alone hard drive! It's their insurance policy against Max - they know he's crazy, this way they have something on him! 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this hard drive - it contains evidence of what Max has been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys exchange looks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get us this drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fennel goes even paler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where it is! They don't let me have access! But-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fennel goes pale when he sees Clay MOVE TOWARD HIM:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait! Please don't kill-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay plasters DUCT TAPE over Fennel's mouth. Stepping outside the Chinook. The others, going with him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warhead, still sitting there. Nobody speaks for a bit. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we hit Goliath headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do what - go after this non- existent hard drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find out if it exists. If it does, we steal it and trade it for immunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a better one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gives us back our lives or we upload the data to the net, show the American people what's being done in their names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why risk our lives again when we already have something to trade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to the WARHEAD. Clay, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to give it back to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to at least discuss it before signing up for another suicide mission on the say-so of some flunky-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque blinks at Clay's abruptness. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want to take down Goliath now? Then who? McDonald's? American Airlines? Microsoft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want Max to pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my life back! This is supposed to be us getting clear - not saving the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not the goddamn good guys anymore! I love you guys, but I had a life before this shit, and I sure as hell am not going to risk getting it back because you came down with a case of the Dudley Damn Do-Rights! 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't raise your voice at me-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will raise whatever the hell I want - you got a death wish because you got beat by a voice on a radio-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP! Clay throws a STRAIGHT RIGHT to Roque's jaw! Roque, surprised and staggered by the blow... Then he SMILES through the blood, DRAWING A KNIFE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna cut your head off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This got serious quick. Pooch steps between them. A really dangerous beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Roque, full on eyefucking one another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Aisha - she seems to be DIGGING IT... Broken by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we hit Goliath. Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goliath. Cougs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't get a vote-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Roque) Goliath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Roque, ODD MAN OUT. His fingers tighten around the handle of the knife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and Roque slides the knife back into it's SCABBARD. Clay, staring at him: 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your life back, you're gonna have to steal it. We hit them in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks away. Roque glowers. Heads the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don'tcha hate it when Mom and Dad fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar grunts in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do about the nuke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I just actually say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Aisha. A smile forming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DESK SERGEANT sips a cup of coffee. Doing the Sunday crossword. Poorly. A quiet afternoon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUB-BUB outside. Rising voices.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Holy- Sarge, come quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant rises, and we follow him through the station towards the front doors. Moving faster and more nervously as the NOISE OUTSIDE GROWS. Finally stepping out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street where a CROWD has gathered. Lookie-loos with camcorders. The Sergeant pushes through them to find

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FENNEL. Eyes wide with fear. DUCT TAPED TO THE WARHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN hangs around his neck that reads Death to America! in big cheery letters and has a SMILEY FACE on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image of FENNEL tied to the bomb, broadcast on the THAI NEWS on a black and white TV. Wade squints at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gonna be a quick trial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful guy, salt of the earth, he'll be missed--who took my bomb, Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna like it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've been such a fan of how things have gone up till now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade shrugs and slides some PHOTOS across the table to him. SCREEN-GRABS from TRAFFIC CAMERAS -- CLAY, ROQUE, and JENSEN in the towncar during the heist. A long beat..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Clay and his unit. You had them killed three years ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also had several African nations overthrown three years ago, I'm a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jamal al-Fadhil situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, they need to get dead. Get me a six man fire team ready in twelve hours. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan? The plan is - get me a six man fire team ready in twelve hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we now clear on the plan or do you want to try a third go-around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because what I'm going to need you to do is get me a six man fire team ready in twelve hours. You get that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade heads for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade turns back. Max, SMILING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need a new bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade waits as FOUR INDIAN MEN climb out of LIMO. The first we recognize as one of the scientists that Wade did not throw out the window. The other three: INDIAN TOUGH GUYS. The scientist got smart, brought some MUSCLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate you meeting us in a single story facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look at that entire incident as your standard "getting to know" each other business orientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. Now that we know each other, know, please, that if you come near me with any more of that Yankee Doodle tough guy bullshit, you will be fed to my dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small smile from Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough, Doc. Can we now move past the verbal aggression and get into some business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another device. One billion dollars is now the price. One billion dollars cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade stares at the scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's going to be difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life the way you people want to live it is very difficult, Mr. Wade. You want less difficult move to my country, study Hinduism. Meditate. Cultivate serenity. Much less difficult. You want to buy atomic bombs... I'm afraid that is a more difficult way of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade drives in a Jeep, heading back to the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants one billion in cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT WITH MAX in the SMOKED UP ASIAN BAR: 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of a paper routes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we swing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't give it to us willingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get that six man team together like I asked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plans. Kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or fire them, whichever's easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly? Firing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine, I'm not a detail guy. What I need- wait. Did you give them intel on Clay's people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaand we're back to killing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll kill them - what are we doing instead? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touchy, touchy. Jeez, what are you related to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, one of them, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's had it) A brother-in-law, I said I'd kill him, what are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what we're doing, it's what Clay is going to do for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us our billion dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay. Sitting on his bed. Shirt off. Going over schematics - GOLIATH WORLD HEADQUARTERS. A KNOCK on Clay' door. He gets up, checks the eye hole. Opens it. AISHA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just going over the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Sexual. Predatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go over the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the room towards him. Reaching for her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go over the plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Aisha. After. Looking out at the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what really happened to you in Afghanistan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay looks over at her. Down at the TEDDY BEAR tattoo... And shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She traces her fingers over it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want Max dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha, taken aback by the suddenness of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bad man. Isn't that enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you tell me about Afghanistan? I'll tell you about Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. It's hot. There's lots of sand. Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha smiles at this. Shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you alone when I found you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That takes Clay off guard. Looking out at the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys got sick of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick of what? 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of hearing about Max. Of hearing me say we had to do something when there wasn't anything to do. They wanted to be around their families. Jensen has a sister. Pooch has a wife and daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hasn't told them he is alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you? The people you loved the most, would you put them in that kind of danger? Aisha, side-stepping the question:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Roque has no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough hate to get us both through the day. He stuck with me when no one else would. And I ain't the easiest guy to stick with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you two really fought, he would kill you, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you care what happens to the others. You wouldn't put them at risk to save yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think that's a weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it is. Law of the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idling. Blacked out windows. Pooch behind the wheel, Cougar shotgun, Roque in back. Back door slides open and Clay and Aisha enter. Together. It doesn't go unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Fed up, Pooch SHUTS THE ENGINE like dad in the family truckster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere until you two squash this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, we're on a schedule here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch takes the keys out of the ignition and folds his arms. Clay sighs. Looks over to Roque. A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I hit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Roque?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A longer beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque? 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I threatened to cut your head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verrrry good. Now don't you two feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit, I do. (starts the van) Now, let's go watch Jensen single- handedly knock over the largest oil company on the planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston, Texas. ESTABLISHING: Skyscrapers. One large one stands out -- The GOLIATH HEADQUARTERS TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN heads towards the building. Street bicycle, bike shorts, messenger bag. He's disguised as a Bike Messenger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got jungle fever, you've got jungle fever, we've got jungle fever, we're in love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen enters the reception area singing. Moves to the receptionist desk. A PRETTY RECEPTIONIST answering phones

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she's gone black-boy crazy, I've gone white-girl hazy, ain't no thinking maybe, we're in love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the Receptionist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Package for Henderson! 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist looks up. She's on the phone, distracted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me one moment-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No can do, chica, gotta put it in his hands. He's gotta sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back on phone) I'm sorry--could you say that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babydoll, I'm on the clock here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist looks up at Jensen, not particularly amused. She points towards the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JENSEN as the elevator doors close on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got jungle fever, you've got jungle fever, we've got jungle fever, we're in love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Jensen opens the messenger bag. REVEAL A SUIT. Pre-set, ready to slide on over his bike clothes. Dials a cell phone while he dresses super fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Henderson, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY sitting in the outer office. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's calling, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Hertz from Internal Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN, PANTSLESS, as the elevator STOPS. The 25th FLOOR. The DOORS OPEN. Two SECRETARIES about to enter the elevator freeze at the sight of PANTSLESS JENSEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies... hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies stare at Jensen. He calculates their gazes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liking the angle of the dangle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOORS SHUT before they can protest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENDERSON, a middle aged mid-level manager reaches for his phone as the secretary looks on from her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Henderson, Richard Hertz from Internal Security. If you'd be kind enough to make your way down to the lobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Can I ask what this is about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen is just about dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a matter of a somewhat sensitive nature involving an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: individual exposing himself to women in the elevators--best discussed in person. If you'd just head on down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson plods into his elevator. As the DOORS CLOSE on his elevator, the DOORS OPEN on the SECOND ELEVATOR. JENSEN, suited and pressed, steps out. Briefcase in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen enters, looking down at Henderson's secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Skippy from tech support. Is Henderson around? I'm supposed to install a firewall on his system-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you just missed him by like two seconds. Can you come back in like an hour or so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen checks his watch. Big sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooh - no can do. Upstairs breathing down my neck. They want security upgraded for the senior managers all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, already moving into HENDERSON'S OFFICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes and I'll be out of your hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK TIGHT SHOTS OF JENSEN doing what Jensen does best: Tearing into Henderson's computer. FROWNING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson's secretary reaching for her phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security? 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen checking his download. Smiles at the Secretary, then looks back to he screen. Pressing his RADIO EARPIECE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to this, the drive exists, Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT WITH THE VAN: Clay shoots a look at Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abso-tootly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it in the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, somewhere off-site. It's gotta be a remote location, stand-alone. I'm checking their security logs-- wherever they've detailed the most guys is probably where it'll be...

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD 1, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: "Skippy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen turns. He's face to face with a solid looking SECURITY OFFICER. He tries a smile:

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD 1, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show me some ID. Real easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen stands up, holding his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Take it easy. You're the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Jensen SMASHES his metal briefcase across the security guard's face! The guard is unconscious before he hits the ground. Keying his RADIO EARPIECE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here, Clay... 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a fire exit thirty yards north of your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, heading for it...

dialogues.speaker: BIG SECURITY 1, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Freeze like a statue, pretty boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen slow turns to find THREE GUNS trained straight at him. Major security. These guys look extremely competent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you, man, I'm a lethal weapon... Jensen turns on the big fellah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was this secret government project. They did stuff to me. Spooky stuff. Anal stuff. Turned me into a dangerous Telekinetic. (wiggles index fingers) As the old saying goes - you don't start none... there won't be none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Security moves in on Jensen with a pair of handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telekinetic your way out of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen RAISES HIS RIGHT HAND at the guard. Fingers cocked like a gun aimed at the guard's Kevlar covered vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard is HIT HARD, BLASTED BACKWARDS off his feet! Screaming in pain, he goes down. Jensen spins, aims his left fingers at the SECOND GUARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the second guard is blown backwards too, KEVLAR VEST SMOKING. Moaning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke my ribs... 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen - Fingers levelled at the THIRD GUARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please- d-don't shoot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JENSEN: Full Dirty Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face down, or I'll make your hearts stop beating with my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They comply. Jensen looks down at them. Smiles. Then slowly turns looking out the FLOOR TO CEILING GLASS WINDOWS. Makes the "OK" sign out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Coug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three tight bullet holes in the glass. SMASH ZOOM out the window, 500 yards to a neighboring office tower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifle, still smoking. Hat low, the ever vigilant COUGAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De Nada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, on the phone. SPEAKING JAPANESE. Wade pokes his head in. Hands him a note -- GOLIATH JUST GOT HIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max cups his hand over the receiver, as the voice on the other end prattles on. To Wade:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By your boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not "my boys". I don't like this. I say we grab Clay and kill the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can find them- 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something in his voice. Max looks at him. Intrigued. Holds up a finger - let me finish up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone; JAPANESE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up; to Wade) Why, Mr. Wade... methinks you have a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Put a fire team together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure? You're not going to call me in two hours and have me kill them? (off Max's look) I'm on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team gathers around as Jensen downloads the Goliath security specs off his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything on Goliath - security, personnel history, the works. Aisha's brow furrows at this. Only we notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the drive being kept?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen spins the laptop around to show them GRAPHICS OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Port of New York, baby. Total stand alone facility, and they're spending 30K a day on onsite security - you don't drop that kinda green to just guard oil. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we up against?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, typing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me check, I--oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's "oh, shit"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen looks up at them. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've hired Par-Sec. A beat. This clearly means something bad to all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Par-Sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paradigm Security Services. Ex- Special Forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically guys like Cougar but without the warm and cuddly side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar just glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goliath must have brought them in after we hit their truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as they ponder the significance of a Par Sec security force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our drive is being guarded by military trained, trigger repressed, blood thirsty, stone cold killers... Am I the only one who's thinking maybe we just chill out and go to Six Flags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comb that drive for every last scrap of info. We're on a plane for New York tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay's room again. Knock at the door again. Aisha again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers his mouth with hers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen and Pooch sitting at a table. Both with laptops. Jensen tapping his keys. Roque enters, carrying a coffee. Stops short, seeing the others. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you guys'd be back at the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. Grabbed a coffee from the machine - you want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't believe how detailed these files are. Every Goliath executive they've ever insured, their policies, their payouts-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the biggest payout? 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be wrongful death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much what we're gonna be risking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen hacked a satellite for me earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you need a satellite for? Pooch shows him the screen of his computer - RECORDED VIDEO from earlier in the day. An OVERHEAD VIEW of a Playground - POOCH'S DAUGHTERS PLAYING. They both watch for a bit. The only sound, Jensen's typing. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we first went over in 2001, Jolene and my oldest Tina wanted to do the yellow ribbon thing, right? Only problem was there was no yellow ribbon to be found - all the stores had been cleaned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military neighborhood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt. And Tina's four at the time, and what she can't understand is why the ribbon's gotta be yellow. So Jolene sings her the song, right? To show her where the idea comes from. And when she's all done, Tina, four years old, looks my wife dead in her eye and says "that's the dumbest song I ever heard."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my wife and my four year old ended up tying a frilly purple ribbon round the old oak tree in our yard to bring Daddy home... 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought that counts, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jolene dated a guy last summer. Didn't turn into anything and I sure as hell can't blame her, but that man was in my house, Roque. I know you're not a hundred percent on this op, but if it can get me back to them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment between them. Broken by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, biggest payout on a Goliath exec ever - 14 million and it was wrongful death - Vice President of Operations in Afghanistan, three years ago, paid to his daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE TRAILS OFF IN SHOCK. Looking to Pooch and Roque:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to need to drive fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Aisha, in bed. After. She traces her fingers along his Teddy Bear tattoo. Clay looks down at her. She gives him a smile. Mixing just the right amount of sensitivity and curiosity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to know about Afghanistan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pooch TEARS through the Texas streets: 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she's gonna kill him?

dialogues.speaker: POOCH AND ROQUE
dialogues.text: (various versions of) Uh-uh. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this man you found in the basement - he was your true target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's true target. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you spoke with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew we were off mission. He knew Max wanted him dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he beg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the basement. Did he beg for his life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begged to die--why are you asking me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha smiles, trying to recover but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The door SPLINTERS INWARDS and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque and Pooch behind him, GUNS DRAWN. Aisha's hand dips into her purse and comes up with a GUN faster than you can spit -- MEXICAN STAND-OFF TIME:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's his daughter, Clay! The guy in the basement's daughter and she's got a gun and it's pointed... (realizing; not happy) ...at my dick! Her gun is pointed at my dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather I pointed it at your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it makes no sense, but actually yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha ADJUSTS, pointing it at his head. As she does, the bedsheet falls away from her UPPER BODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't see the goods, but our guys in the doorway do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha watches them. CLOSE ON THEIR EYES. Nobody moves. Nobody breathes. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen's eyes FLICK DOWNWARD. Just for a millisecond but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Jensen, falls back screaming, HIT IN THE SHOULDER - Aisha, moving and firing, running for the bathroom nude - The guys UNLOADING AT HER -- she dives through the doorwa HOLES PUNCHED IN THE WALL behind Clay's head as she RETUR FIRE through the drywall -- Clay, diving to the floor below the crossfire -- Aisha kicks the BATHROOM DOOR SHUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly EVERYONE'S RELOADING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as clips are slapped into weapons until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAPS HIS EAR. They stop. Listening... CHOPPERS. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, she's got back-up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay pulls on his pants and they run for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...smack into COUGAR who points into the sky -- TWO HEAVI ARMED COBRAS, searchlights on, headed for the motel. And again with that one important word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRST COBRA OPENS UP with it's AUTOMATIC CANNON. The BULLETS CHEWING UP the far side of the CHEAP TWO STORY MOTEL! Our guys VAULT the railing, sprinting to the van..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH, sliding behind the wheel as the others pile in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch hits the gas before his door is even shut. As they PEEL OUT of the PARKING LOT -- The STRAFING hits the GAS MAIN -- WHOOMP! Half the motel SWALLOWED in a FIREBALL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think that got her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't that lucky. Jensen, status!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dick remains unshot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque, looking out the back window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, the COBRAS are now tracking the VAN. Spotlights, swinging towards them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The asphalt behind them ERUPTS. CANNON-FIRE blowing HUGE CHUNKS OF ROAD into the sky! SCREAMING over the SOUND: 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody shoot something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar HEFTS HIS RIFLE. Setting up shop in the back. Sighting the choppers through his scope. Jensen, excited, and a little delirious from blood loss:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Cougar's got a plan! Coug, do you have a plan? (to the others) He's got a plan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to steer) Stop yelling at the sniper! THROUGH THE SCOPE -- Cougar sights the TAIL ROTOR of the chopper on the left... Smiles, PRESSES THE TRIGGER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see how one bullet can bring down two helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet strikes the tail rotor DEAD CENTER -- it SHORT and spins off -- sending the chopper itself into a spin - COLLIDING with it's TWIN CHOPPER on the right -- they both twist and hink up -- their ROTORS SLICING INTO EACH OTHER -- both FINALLY CAREENING ONTO THE FREEWAY BEHIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys. Driving away from the carnage of two exploding Cobra Helicopters splattered across the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming in for LANDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it taxis towards a HANGAR. Max straightens his suit. Wade on the phone, frowning. Bad news. He flips the phone shut. To Max:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Wade's look) We know exactly where they're going, Wade. Port of New York, for their big final awesome stand against the forces of evil where they die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He claps Wade and the shoulder and heads down the steps..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where the TWO INDIAN SCIENTISTS wait. The Indian THUG CREW has been beefed-up to about TEN BIZARRE LOOKING, BLACK SUITED TOUGH GUYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, always with the money! So impersonal! How are you? How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recently attended the funeral of my best friend who you had thrown out a window. How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't complain. I'm thinking of getting satellite radio in my car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a freak. Too much Ronald McDonald. Too much fantasy football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max smiles and spreads his arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm all about the bombs, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have your ordinance. You have twenty four hours to get the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks over to Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go make a withdrawal... 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns back to the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New change of plan. You stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go get your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll get your money. You stay right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAUSE as Max contemplates this little twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, are you short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty three hours, fifty nine minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade heads for the jet. Max watches him go. As Wade boards the jet Max takes a big sigh. For the first time, looks like a guy who might not be quite as sure of things as he would like. Max Looks back to the Short Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you weigh? Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not think you are funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is my bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Short Scientist points to a large flatbed pick-up. A HEAVY TARPED BOMB LIKE PACKAGE strapped to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not get it till I get the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a guy who's all about transcending materialism, you talk about money so much! 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you keep talking, Pop-Amm will cut your mouth out of your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After business hours. A WINDOW SMASHES. Roque climbs inside. Goes to the front and unlocks it for the others, who carry a BLEEDING JENSEN in. They lay him on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She burned us, Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole op is compromised-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fallen comrade here! Blood flowing out of his body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, precious blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar? Cougar nods. Gathers gauze, needle, thread, and a WOODEN DOWEL. Comes over as Jensen looks at the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar SHOVES IT BETWEEN JENSEN'S TEETH as an answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we split up again. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay doesn't respond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Clay, whatever she knows, Max knows! It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words echo through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN SCREAMS through the dowel as Cougar sews him up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how low they've sunk. Clay finally looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We split up. Some of us should go international. I'll do that if nobody else wants to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we just run again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing else we can do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years is enough. If there's a drive at that port that we can use to get clear-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of "he knows we're coming for it" do you not get? They're gonna be waiting for us. Par-Sec is gonna waiting for us... 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So figure out a way around them; you're good at that shit, Clay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, addressing all of them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We run now, we're gonna be running forever. This is our one chance to get our lives back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To steal them back. And I'm prepared to do anything to any one to make that happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks Clay dead in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never play a longshot, you're never gonna win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Clay, not breaking his look with Roque:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, what's the minimum time to scout the patrols, get an accurate head count on-site at the Port?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 hours, but Aisha knows that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we hit them in twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque smiles. Pooch blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hours from now? You mean-- you want us to go in blind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last thing they'll expect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cause it's dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen's already got the layout, and Cougar can spot on site. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar nods. He's in. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cause gettin' shot is awesome, I'm totally up for doing it again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives a weak thumbs-up. In. All that's left is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, struggling with the decision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time we went in blind on an op, we lost everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Pooch looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's go get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING. The harbor is enormous. A small TWIN HURRICANE BOAT cuts through the morning waves. Half mile from the Goliath docks. At the controls, Clay and Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLIATH EMPLOYEES going about their business, preparing for a tanker docking. All seems normal until we look a bit closer: FOUR-MAN Par Sec security patrols. Bomb sniffing DOGS. Two Cobra ATTACK CHOPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOLIATH TANKER approaches from behind. Roque looks back at the tanker. Not answering - he seems to have something on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque? 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay drops the twin throttles and spins the speed boat towards the APPROACHING TANKER. Several TUGS and SECURITY LAUNCHES are maneuvering around it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Roque approach one of the launches from behind. Climbing aboard. They take the two SECURITY MEN from behind with TASERS, then strip off their outer gear, revealing PAR-SEC UNIFORMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in. Status.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A block off the front gate. A blacked out Chevy van. Pooch sits behind the wheel. Ready for exfiltration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pooch is good.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Cougar, squelch if you're in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drainage pipe with a thick security cage covering it. We PUSH IN HARD, reveal a small opening cut in the cage it -- THROUGH the opening -- FIRE 70 FEET into the pipe - through a second opening -- down another long pipe and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM UP HARD ON COUGAR. Crouched BELOW the terminal. Looking up through a grilled man hole at Par-sec Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squelch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Roque dock their Launch and hop out. Blending in perfectly with the Par-Sec Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, we're coming. You ready? 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge shipping room with hundreds of crates. We push in on a LARGE WOODEN CRATE. The side of the crate STARTS TO FLEX... and SPLINTERS as Jensen breaks out of his box!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the crowd goes wild...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Roque approach. Knock. From the inside, Jensen leaning up against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the password?

dialogues.speaker: ROQUE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Open the door before we kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen opens the door. Clay and Roque quickly move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive should be in the Computer Room, two skylights over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque and I will set the charges here but we won't detonate until you have the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't settle for stealing the drive, you gotta blow up Goliath's shit too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say, I hold a grudge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen nods. Knows how important his job is. Heading for a ladder. Clay and Roque begin to set CHARGES throughout the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be ready to move the second Cougar hits the fire alarm... 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar avoiding security. SCALING A LARGE OIL TANK, takin up a sniper position on top of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen hopping rooftop to rooftop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar in full sniper fire position. His sights dead on: A MASTER FIRE ALARM -- 300 yards down. His RADIO CRACKLES

dialogues.speaker: POOCH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Guys, we got a problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch in the van, seeing through BINOCULARS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he is. Being given a TOUR by PAR-SEC GUARDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: POOCH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No. I say we roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, by a MIRRORED SKYLIGHT (so you can't see down into the room). Attaching a HARNESS to his waist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm above the computer room, maybe thirty seconds from the drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, listening through the radio:

dialogues.speaker: POOCH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wade's headed your way - last chance to get the duck out of Fodge... 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's not right. Something...

dialogues.speaker: ROQUE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque, standing in front of a HUGE CARGO CONTAINER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should see this. Roque's got the doors of the container opened that he's looking in. Clay approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, finally ready to hit the computer room, GENUFLECT once for luck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Roque staring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think... Aisha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CONTAINER -- Top to bottom, completely loaded with fresh minted stack BUNDLES OF CASH. More physical money than we have ever seen. By a lot. Ever. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not Aisha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay turns to him as -- WHAM! -- a CROWBAR SMASHES DOWN on his head! Roque, gripping it, looking down at Clay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, for a revenge driven conspiracy nut, you're pretty fucking gullible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, leaping through the SKYLIGHT... SMASHING DOWN through the GLASS... 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And landing in an EMPTY ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No computers. No stand-alone drives. No nothing. Except for PAR-SEC GUARDS with weapons trained at his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch sitting in the van, into the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen, you get it? Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does not see the FIVE PAR-SEC SOLDIERS moving in on his car, long guns up and out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar flexed and aimed. Scope locked in on the fire alarm... CLICK! Safety off on a gun pressed to his temple. Fuck. He LAYS DOWN THE GUN and puts his hands behind his head. Furious at himself for GETTING CAUGHT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the shadows, WADE ENTERS. Clay looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Clay. Been awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head wounds bleed bad. The crowbar caused a mother of a gusher on Clay. He wipes blood from his eyes. Manages:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the truck. I got tired of waiting for you to save us, so I up and saved myself. Reached out like I said and cut a deal - I set this up, I go free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins walking around Clay as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traitor... 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me no choice. It was always gonna end like this, Clay. Us captured or dead. It was always a dead end. You made sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bullshit. You were gonna keep planning missions and ways to hit Max until it got us all killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Clay. Yes. Only difference with this situation is at least I get to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all could have walked... used the drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it yet? There is no drive. There never was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade BEGINS LAUGHING. Clay looks like he's been slapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fennel made it up to save himself. When I told Wade, he planted the info at Goliath to lead you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really thought there was a happy ending coming? Pooch was gonna get his family back, we were gonna get to be soldiers again? (leans down; softly) We lost the moment we went off mission. This is just the logical conclusion of that playing out. You didn't want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just wanted your revenge. Your face-to-face with the big bad wolf. I'm sorry, buddy, but it's the way of the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque straightens back up, shaking his head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys like us don't beat guys like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner, Wade nods at this. Behind him, A LARGE SEMI pulls up to the CASH CONTAINER. Over the following, a hydraulic lift hoists the cash container onto the truck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me now... Maybe you live through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're not gonna kill you. Someone's gotta get away with the cash. Your crew? I'm definitely wasting them. But you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to the HYDRO-WINCH slowly lowering the CASH CONTAINER onto the flat bed, with a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to steal a billion dollars from the Central Intelligence Agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay stares at daggers at both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for our replacement nuke. When a billion goes missing, people tend to ask who took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max really does love to frame you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Par-Sec Guards arrive. Wade points to Clay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him away. Drop him in Newark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you at Turner Airfield. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards handcuff Clay and drag him to his feet. Pushin him towards the door. As he hustled past Roque:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop. Roque looks at his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry it had to end this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to die very badly. The guards hustle Clay out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAR-SEC GUARDS lead the Pooch, Jensen, and Cougar towards the far end of the terminal. Each, bound. Cougar looks up to see a separate set of Guards leading CLAY the opposite way. Their eyes connect - both knowing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering the question) Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar lowers his head, sadly. Clay's pushed into A TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone. The Guards take Pooch, Jensen, and Cougar BEHIND A WAREHOUSE. Looking at each other. Knowing, this is the end of the line. The Lead Guard RACKS HIS MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch SPITS AT HIM. The Lead Guard calmly SHOOTS HIM in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch SCREAMS. Falls. The Par-Sec boys force Cougar and Jensen down too, CLUBBING THEM with their rifles. Pooch looks up at his assailant. Gasps through the pain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on with it... 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lead Guard smiles. Looks to Cougar, who's shredding his skin to the bone trying to claw out of the cuffs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps forward to take it, but Cougar is too quick for the man, MOVING HIS HEAD AWAY. He reaches for Cougar again. Again, Cougar evades. The guards laugh at their colleague, who continues trying to grab Cougar's hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lead Guard has had enough of Cougar's antics. Levelling the rifle at his head...

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't really care of there's a hole in it. One wash, good as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you smiling at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar's nods past him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Guards turn to see ON TOP OF AN OIL TANK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she rises up to standing, A SLANT-K 600 ROCKET HIP BLASTER locked and loaded. Looking like an Old Testament style Goddess of Vengeance and Destruction. A moment of FROZEN SHOCK on the rest of Wade's Hit Crew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she pulls the trigger. A HIGH PITCHED WHISTLE as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROCKET STREAKS across the Terminal! Headed straight for an ENORMOUS FUEL TANK... KA-BOOM! The explosion ROCKS THE ENTIRE TERMINAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Truck Clay is prisoner in is BLOWN INTO THE AIR by the SHOCKWAVE... SMASHING down onto it's side, skidding..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar and Jensen DESTROY the remaining Par-Secs with legs. Grabbing cuff keys and freeing themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't have gone after the hat... 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Cougar kicks the Guard in the face, knocking him cold. Aisha rappels off the Oil Tower in the distance. VARIOUS PAR-SEC TEAMS fire at her! Cougar scoops up two rifles and tosses one to Jensen - they give her covering fire as she comes! As he shoots, to the wounded Pooch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been shot in both legs, what kind of dumbass question is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so we're Mr. Grumpy now? You're not the only one who's been shot recently, you know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He empties a full clip into a Par-Sec team and reloads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AISHA -- Pinned down forty yards away. Almost out of AMMO. Par-Sec Team, almost on top of her when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE emerges from an OVERTURNED TRUCK. GUN in each hand, BLAZING. The Par-Secs cut down one by one. The figure lowers his guns. Desert Eagles. Walks up to her. Underneath the blood, oil, and grime, it's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY. They stare at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, incredibly, Aisha RAISES HER WEAPON AT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill my father? Jensen comes running up, interrupting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of in the middle of something here, Jensen-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no drive, Clay- 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on Aisha)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no drive and Roque's gone and Par-Sec's regrouping and Pooch could bleed out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha's had enough, thumbing the hammer back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, about to respond when:

dialogues.speaker: COUGAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see our LONG TALL SNIPER standing above them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked us. It was mercy. But you're his family, so I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, incredibly, Cougar lays his rifle at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But only me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay and Jensen blink, shocked. Aisha stares at Cougar, equally surprised. She levels her pistol AT HIS HEAD... Silence. We CUT WIDE to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUNSHOT. Muzzle flash from Aisha's gun. COUGAR FALLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In close again. Aisha stands over Cougar's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others, stunned... And then Cougar rises. Face BLOODY. Cheek ripped open, from where the bullet creased his flesh. She FIRES AGAIN - BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identical scar on his other cheek. Blood runs down his face. He doesn't move to wipe it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wear it. Remember him. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar nods. Leans down, picks up his rifle. Debt paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, excellent, very tribal--We need to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if on cue, BULLETS kick up DUST around them! A new Par-Sec team, incoming. Clay, Jensen, Aisha, and Cougar hightail it back to where Pooch lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is stupid question day, isn't it? It's stupid question day and someone forgot to tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay slings Pooch over his shoulders fireman carry style. Looks across the Terminal to where Pooch's van is parked. PUSH IN on Clay's face for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they do. Sprinting across the open space IN SLO-MO, Cougar and Aisha WASTING EVERYTHING THAT MOVES. A full on ballet of fully automatic mayhem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make it to the van! Piling in! Cougar behind the wheel GUNS THE ENGINE and they PEEL OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling on to the HIGHWAY. Silence sets in. The high of the firefight, over. Just pain and loss now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five people, some terribly wounded, with nowhere to go. Just the rocking of the van as it heads down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won. We lost. Way it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way it always goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay looks at him. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we should just head home. Oh, wait, that's right. We don't have homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay doesn't respond. Aisha studies him. Nods. Knows what has to be done. They all do. From behind the wheel:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay looks up at the use of rank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade pulls up in a Corvette. Gets out and walks over as Roque finishes supervising Par-Sec guards finish loading the CASH onto a HUGE TRANSPORT PLANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friends jack-rabbitted. Should we be worried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay doesn't take risks. It's why I'm here and he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? Why'd you stick with those losers for so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque considers. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade half smiles at this. Shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such thing. I'll go call Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins walking towards HANGAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! As the FENCE by the AIRSTRIP is SMASHED INWARDS by the Van! Headed straight for him! Clay, WAVING: 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Wade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque turns to the Pilot:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Declan, start the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE raises his UZI and FIRES - Taking out the Van's fron tires! THE VAN Flips! Smashing end over end, finally coming to a rest on it's side! Climbing out, groaning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, remind me - car crash first, then get shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds less painful that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay looks across the tarmac to see the plane begin to Taxi. ROQUE stands in they back - loading ramp still down. FLIPS CLAY A SALUTE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar and I are going after that plane. The rest of you, get Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and legless Pooch are on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is she going? Aisha is heading off to the fenceline... Clay and Cougar run for Wade's CORVETTE. Cougar slides behind the wheel and starts her up, PEELING OUT after the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call me legless Pooch again, you're gonna be Headless Jensen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, it's a cool name! It makes you sound like a pirate! (off his look) Fine, let's go kill Wade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar guns the engine, catching up to the TAXIING TRANSPORT PLANE. Clay leans out the window, shooting at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huddled in the plane's CARGO HOLD, RETURNING FIRE. The PILOT, yelling to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have enough runway to take off - we're going to have to turn around and come back to get up to speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, just get us in the air! He fires ANOTHER BURST from his weapon at the Vette! CLICK - his WEAPON DRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CORVETTE -- SIMULTANEOUSLY, Clay, WEAPON DRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares through the windshield to look at Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen enters, carrying a MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoo-hoo! Wade! (a'la the Warriors) Come out and plaaaayyy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of an engine -- Jensen DIVES out of the way as Wade WHIPS PAST on a MOTORCYCLE! Heading for the runway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wade's coming at you! I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off. Looking at THE LEAR JET that Wade arrived in. Sitting in the Hangar's Corner. Keys the radio... 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just found our way out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette, pulling behind the still lowered REAR RAMP of the TRANSPORT PLANE! Clay, onto the CORVETTE'S HOOD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque, rising to meet him. Waiting for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay JUMPS! Landing on the ramp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CARGO HOLD - Roque smiles. Pulls a WICKED LOOKING KNIFE. The two men stand there. Sizing one another up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta admit, I always wondered how this would play out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha thinks you kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a distinct possibility...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin circling one another. Clay, still weaponless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a knife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit of as longshot for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque LUNGES AT HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Clay does have a knife. He PULLS IT and SLAMS IT into Roque's belly! Roque, stunned! Staggers back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
