dialogues.text: For most men, that would be the end of the fight. But not these two. Roque gives Clay a bloody grin. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I really am gonna cut your head off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LUNGES AGAIN! And now it is FULLY ON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blades whip up and down - almost too fast to see Roque gets Clay with a left cross, then buries his knife in Clay's shoulder. Clay twists free, slashes at Roque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds in, the men separate again. Breathing hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay sees Roque doesn't have his knife. Looks - realizing it's still embedded in his own shoulder. Pulls it out, TOSSES IT BACK TO ROQUE. They stand there, both panting.. Then RUN AT EACH OTHER full tilt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's how it ends. And pay attention, IT HAPPENS FAST:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay goes low -- coming up to grab Roque's knife hand, which is arcing DOWNWARDS TOWARDS CLAY'S THROAT -- Clay manages to HALT THE HAND, blade inches from his Adam's apple -- and there's a moment where Roque could overpower him and actually cut his head off... But Clay THROWS HIS WEIGHT FORWARD and BREAKS ROQUE'S RIGHT ARM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for the first time, Roque SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which seems to make Clay happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he BREAKS ROQUE'S LEFT ARM too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roque falls to his knees, BROKEN, BLOODY, AND BEATEN... TO REVEAL -- The PILOT. Leaning out of the cockpit, DESER EAGLE levelled at Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot PULLS THE TRIGGER. The bullet slams into Clay's abdomen and BLOWS HIM off his feet backwards -- FLYING OUT OF THE PLANE -- And landing on hood of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay SMASHES DOWN ON the windshield -- Cougar pumps the brakes and spins the wheel -- desperately trying to keep Clay from rolling off the hood... 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURNING AROUND at the end of the runway. Beginning it's final run to get up to speed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now driving TOWARDS IT on a chicken-like collision course when WHOOSH! WADE FLIES PAST ON HIS MOTORCYCLE! Clay turns to Cougar through the spiderwebbed windshield:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rifle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar passes Clay his SNIPER RIFLE and FLOORS IT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT ONE END OF THE RUNWAY, the plane starting to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE OPPOSITE END, Wade's motorcycle heading full speed at the approaching plane. Cougar and Clay, chasing Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then AISHA steps out INTO THE MIDDLE of the runway. The ROCKET LAUNCHER clutched in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a knee. Aims at the plane, which is almost at lift speed. ROQUE sees her from the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks eyes with him and GRINS -- FIRING into the LANDING GEAR of the plane AS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULLS EVEN WITH WADE. Instead of shooting, Clay THROWS Cougar's RIFLE BETWEEN THE SPOKES of Wade's FRONT TIRE, causing the bike to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATAPULT WADE OFF and FORWARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THROUGH THE AIR and into the RIGHT NUMBER TWO JET ENGI of the now flying cargo plane. The ENGINE EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisha, somehow safe on the ground, looking up at the escaping plane. Clay looking up. All of them watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Roque dies very badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOMP! The big plane EXPLODES in a MONSTER FIREBALL--VA DOOOM! Burning gas and iron and cash. FIRE RULES. 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys. Bloody, eyes bitterly triumphant. Clay stares at the sight before him. Only one word for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jensen approaches, supporting Pooch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to rain on everyone's we killed all the bad guys parade, but we should probably get gone - legless Pooch has a Learjet all gassed up for us in the Hangar. (off Pooch's look) It's a cool name-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the smashed up bike Wade was driving, WADE'S CELL PHONE RINGS. Clay gets off the hood of the Vette and Cougar and Aisha help him hobble over. Answering it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX and the INDIANS. INTERCUT with Clay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CLAY realizing who he's talking to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not by a longshot. You're not having a real great day, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a voice on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working on the engines. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as it hits Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, yes. Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you've always wanted to meet face to face. I'm sure that could be arranged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think the guys you're about to stiff for a billion dollars are going to allow that to happen. (looks to the others) We win. You lose. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps the phone shut and tosses it into the fire. Turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lear jet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready when you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, Jensen, and Cougar start for the Hangar. Clay looks to Aisha. A moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to find and punish those responsible for my father's death. Max, his men, everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That why you slept with me? 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That and the cardio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good cause there's no way I could walk it... She helps him up and we begin to PULL UP AND BACK as they head for the Hangar. Together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lowers the phone. Looking stunned. The Short Scientist has run out of patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is up, Stretch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at the Short Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretch. That's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't look like he's very amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you are so much taller than I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I get it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momentary pause. The Short Scientist looks at Max. Slowly gets up, LEAVES MAX alone in the room with the ten Indian Max takes a deep breath, looks up at the DEATH SQUAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gentlemen consider yourselves to be soldiers or businessmen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it's the end. But then we hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND. Blowing through trees. Crickets. The soft sound of evening television. Somewhere suburban...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice quiet neighborhood. Outside the kitchen window Pooch's wife JOLENE, doing dishes in the sink again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUSTLING. Jolene looks up this time. She obviously heard it. She puts down the dishes and goes to the door. Opens it and looks out to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Not even by the swingset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs. About to head back inside when she spies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLINT OF LIGHT. By the oak tree in the front. She steps outside. Walks down until she sees what it is. Her breath hitches in her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frilly purple ribbon is tied around the old oak tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now there are tears in Jolene's eyes. Because she knows what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband is alive. And he will make it home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday.
